author: jgm
content:
Trouble with this is it basically forces the exit.  So if, for example, there was some sort of bug resulting in exits losing funds then a malicious user could run the transaction and force the exit.

One option for this could be to have a pre-agreed fork version at which exits will be available (e.g. `0x00100000`), and publish the signed exit for that fork version.  That way, the exit will be invalid until internally everything is ready to go, then we have a HF that 'enables' such transfers.
